summary: This document is a declaration by Steven Hayes, a custodian of records for Sprint, certifying compliance with a grand jury subpoena dated August 13, 2019, issued by Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos. It attests to the authenticity and proper maintenance of business records provided in response to the subpoena.

persons.name: Steven Hayes
persons.role: Custodian of Records / Subpoena Specialist for Sprint
persons.context: Declares under penalty of perjury that Sprint's records provided in response to a grand jury subpoena are authentic and maintained in the regular course of business.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated August 13, 2019, requesting specified records from Sprint.

connections.description: Hayes, as custodian for Sprint, is responding to a grand jury subpoena issued by Roos.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Sprint
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos signs a grand jury subpoena requesting specified records from Sprint.

events.title: Declaration of Custodian of Records Executed
events.description: Steven Hayes executes a declaration certifying the authenticity of Sprint's records provided in response to the grand jury subpoena.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Sprint on August 13, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation, indicating law enforcement sought telecommunications records.
Steven Hayes, a Sprint subpoena specialist, certified under penalty of perjury that the provided records were authentic and maintained in the regular course of business.
The document demonstrates the use of legal procedures (Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6)) to authenticate business records for evidentiary purposes.
The subpoena and declaration occurred in August 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019, suggesting immediate investigative follow-up on potential communications evidence.
The declaration itself is a standard legal form used to establish a foundation for admitting business records into evidence in court proceedings.
